resident.translation[0].definitions[0].d: someone who lives or stays in a particular place
resident.translation[0].definitions[1].d: a doctor working at a hospital where he or she is being trained
resident.translation[1].definitions[0].e: Many retired British people are now resident in Spain.
resident.translation[1].definitions[1].d: living or working in a particular place or institution
resident.translation[1].definitions[1].e: The resident population of mental hospitals has fallen by 20%.
resident.translation[1].definitions[2].d: belonging to a particular group of people – used humorously
resident.translation[1].definitions[2].e: He’s our resident expert on computer games.
resident.translation[2].definitions[0].d: someone who lives permanently in a particular place
resident.translation[2].definitions[0].e: Interest is paid to UK residents without further liability to basic rate tax.
Mining companies provided mainly unskilled work for local residents.
resident.translation[2].definitions[1].d: someone who is staying in a particular hotel
resident.translation[2].definitions[1].e: At present the hotel bar is open to residents only.
